content:
Diagnosis:		Left breast cancer - Grade 2 papillary carcinoma

Management:		Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy March 2023
		Adjuvant radiotherapy completed June 2023

Histology:		pT2N0M0 Grade 2 papillary carcinoma
		ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative
		BRCA variant of uncertain significance

Current situation:	Routine follow-up on adjuvant endocrine therapy

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She is tolerating anastrozole well with only mild joint stiffness managed with regular exercise. Her breast symptoms have settled following radiotherapy with no ongoing concerns. Clinical examination shows good cosmetic outcome with no suspicious findings in either breast or axillae. Recent mammogram on 15/4/24 shows post-treatment changes only. Blood tests including liver function are satisfactory. She will continue anastrozole and return to clinic in 6 months with repeat blood tests.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative, BRCA variant of uncertain significance

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

patient_facts.value: Good cosmetic outcome with no suspicious findings in either breast or axillae
Blood tests including liver function satisfactory

status_updates.value: Early stage breast cancer post surgery and radiotherapy. Stable on adjuvant anastrozole with good tolerance
Mild joint stiffness managed with regular exercise
Return to clinic in 6 months with repeat blood tests
